thread.title: Eric Garner’s pregnant daughter allegedly beaten by boyfriend
thread.title_full: Eric Garner’s pregnant daughter allegedly beaten by boyfriend

author: STEPHEN REX BROWN, GRAHAM RAYMAN
title: Eric Garner’s pregnant daughter allegedly beaten by boyfriend
text:
Eric Garner’s pregnant daughter claims boyfriend choked, punched her Eric Garner’s pregnant daughter allegedly beaten by boyfriend Erica Garner, 26, speaks to the media on Feb. 5, 2015. Police are searching for her boyfriend, who's accused of attacking her. (Jeff Bachner/for New York Daily News) NEW YORK DAILY NEWS   7:45 PM 
The pregnant daughter of Eric Garner posted a series of tweets Monday alleging a boyfriend choked her, punched her in the face and forced her to drink laxative he told her was acid. 
He “forced his way into my apartment hit me in the mouth and made me drink 2 bottles of laxative when I told him I was pregnant,” Erica Garner wrote on Twitter. 
Eric Garner died after he was placed in a banned chokehold by police on Staten Island on July 17, 2014. His namesake daughter has often used her Twitter account to send political messages. 
She alleges the boyfriend sprayed lighter fluid on her and gave her a fat lip. 
Eric Garner's mom arrested during SCOTUS protest at Trump Tower 
“He tried to kill my child and me,” Garner, 26, wrote. “And roughed up my 90 year old grandma.” 
She added, “He told me the laxative was acid when he was pouring (it) into my mouth. I was terrified.” 
Cops said Garner filed a criminal complaint at 9:30 a.m. Monday at the 90th Precinct stationhouse in Williamsburg. Undated family photo shows Eric Garner, who died after he was placed in a banned chokehold by police on Staten Island on July 17, 2014. (AP) 
Cops said the boyfriend repeatedly punched her after she tried to call 911 and briefly choked her — though she never lost consciousness. 
NYC rejects protesters' contention loudspeakers are weapons 
He also said, “I have a gun on me and you know that,” according to police. He grabbed her cell phone and fled. Cops are looking for the man. Garner was taken to Woodhull Hospital and later released. 
“The baby will be fine fortunately,” Garner said. “NYPD is only charging him with assault and robbery. He told me he was force feeding me acid while holding me hostage in my home.” 
Garner then referred to the death of her 43-year-old father at the hands of police in 2014. 
“This man outright tried to kill me. He is still on the loose. I’m f-
